citation.article-title: Pseudomonas lini sp. nov., a novel species from bulk and rhizospheric soils.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Pseudomonas lini sp. nov.
Pseudomonas lini (li'ni. L. n. linum flax; L. gen. n. lini of flax, referring to the plant genus, Linum, from which the type strain CFBP 5737T was isolated)
Cells from stationary-phase culture of CFBP 5737T are straight rods (0.5-1.0 by 1.5-5.0 μm), Gram-negative, motile by several polar flagella.
Growth occurs between 4 and 36 °C, but not at 41 °C.
The white-yellowish colonies on solid KB are smooth, circular with regular margins and moderately convex, and, after 2 days, produce a yellow-green fluorescence with UV light (365 nm).
Aerobic growth, oxidase-positive, arginine dihydrolase-positive, not pectinolytic.
Produces no hypersensitive reaction on tobacco leaves.
The species reduces nitrogen oxides under anaerobic conditions.
Hydrolyses gelatin, but not DNA and aesculin.
Acid produced from mannitol, sorbitol and sucrose, but not from erythritol.

Results obtained with Biotype 100 strips indicate that the strains are able to assimilate the following substrates: cis-aconitate, trans-aconitate, D-alanine, L-alanine, DL-α-amino-n-butyrate, L-arabinose, L-aspartate, betaine, caprate, caprylate, citrate, diaminobutane, β-D-fructose, fumarate, L-glutamate, glutarate, DL-glycerate, L-histidine, p-hydroxybenzoate, DL-β-hydroxybutyrate, D-galactose, D-gluconate, α-D-glucose, glycerol, DL-lactate, L-malate, D-mannitol, D-mannose, mucate, myo-inositol, L-proline, protocatechuate, quinate, D-saccharate, L-serine, D-sorbitol, succinate, sucrose and D-trehalose.

The following substrates are not utilized as sole carbon and energy sources: adonitol, L-arabitol, D-cellobiose, m-coumarate, dulcitol, erythritol, aesculin, α-L-fucose, β-gentiobiose, gentisate, m-hydroxybenzoate, hydroxyquinoline-β-glucuronide, histamine, itaconate, alactose, lactulose, D-lyxose, maltose, maltotriose, D-melezitose, α-D-melibiose, meso-tartrate, 1-O-methyl-α-galactopyranoside, 1-O-methyl-β-galactopyranoside, maltitol, 5-keto-D-gluconate, 3-O-methyl-D-glucopyranose, 1-O-methyl-α-D-glucopyranoside, 1-O-methyl-β-D-glucopyranoside, palatinose, phenylacetate, 3-phenylpropionate, D-raffinose, α-L-rhamnose, L-sorbose, D-tagatose, tricarballylate, trigonelline, tryptamine, D-turanose, D-xylose and xylitol.

Assimilation of N-acetyl-D-glucosamine, DL-α-aminon-valerate, D-arabitol, benzoate, ethanolamine, dgalacturonate, 2-keto-D-gluconate, D-glucosamine, D-glucuronate, α-ketoglutarate, D-malate, malonate, propionate, D-ribose, D-D-tartrate, L-tartrate, L-tryptophan and L-tyrosine is variable.

Type strain is strain DLE411JT which has been deposited in the Collection Française de Bactéries Phytopathogénes (CFBP, UMR de Pathologie Végétale, INRA-INH/Université, 49071 Beaucouzé cedex, France) under the number CFBP 5737T and in the International Collection of Microorganisms from Plants (ICMP, Auckland, New Zealand) under the number ICMP 14138T.
